title: Canons Ashby Walking Route

images.title: Sarah Charlesworth / Garden terrace of Canons Ashby House
images.caption: Garden terrace of the house. The tower of St Marys Church can be seen in the background.

images.title: Marion Haworth / Canons Ashby - the garden looking away from the house
images.caption: The garden looking away from the house

images.title: Graham Horn / Bluebells in Ashby Gorse
images.caption: Bluebells in Ashby Gorse. Adjacent to Oxford Lane (byway) is Ashby Gorse, a small woodland full of bluebells. There is also a lake shown on the map but this is not visible from the byway.

images.title: Ian Rob / Canons Ashby
images.caption: Bottom Pool near South West Farm

images.title: Rob Farrow / St. Mary's, Canons Ashby - Eastern façade
images.caption: Priory church of St Mary. The east end, viewed from the overgrown churchyard that covers much of site where once stood the Augustinian priory founded here in the 12th century.

images.title: David P Howard / The original entrance gates at Canons Ashby
images.caption: The original entrance gates at Canons Ashby.

description: This circular walk explores the gardens, parkland and countryside surrounding this Elizabethan manor house near Daventry . Stroll through the beautiful 18th-century gardens with topiary and formal bedding before heading into the parkland with its old deer park, woodland and lakes. You can also explore the house with grand rooms, stunning tapestries and Jacobean plasterwork. This walk starts at the parking area at Canons Ashby and then takes you into the lovely Northamptonshire countryside surrounding the estate. You'll visit the pretty medieval village of Moreton Pinkney with its 18th century cottages linked by a communal wisteria.  The walk then makes use of the Macmillan Way and quiet country lanes to take you to Crockwell Farm and Woodfordhill before heading through the delightful parkland of Canons Ashby.
